programmes.show_description: Else decides to take the government's advice and begins her own campaign to save energy. S5 E4: Three Day Week
With The Moody Blues and David Essex. The legendary BAFTA-winning music and comedy show from Thames TV (1979). All in the best possible taste!
A successful businessman begins to divest his assets and interests following a dreadful car accident; is foul play afoot, and can Simon spot what is happening? S2 E22: The Invisible Millionaire
A selection of live performances from TV music shows in the 1960s for a genuine taste of the best of the '60s!
Sharon and Tracey work out that Dorien has an important birthday coming up - and decide that the event calls for a celebration whatever she thinks. S12 E8: Forever Young
Thomas gets to meet Sally's uncle Leonard, who is a showbiz agent; when Leonard dies of a heart attack not long after, Sally is left to sort things out. S3 E6: A Roman Empire
A selection of live performances from TV music shows in the 1960s for a genuine taste of the best of the '60s!

Your favourite music from the 1960s - non-stop.
Your favourite music from the 1960s - non-stop.
Examining the history of war tactics. A raid is an offensive military operation that aims to achieve a specific objective. It is a battleplan which often requires elite special forces. S2 E2
The best-kept secrets of the air campaign in the Gulf War are uncovered, from classified spy plane missions to strategic plans to destroy Iraqi targets. S2 E2: The Gulf War - Steel Rain
The many variants of the A-1 Skyraider single piston-engined fighter bomber helped dominate the air to ground attack role in Vietnam and earned quite the reputation. S2 E4
Colonel Tim Collins investigates the brilliant Axis intelligence coup which helped Erwin Rommel's Afrika Korps sweep forward to threaten Cairo. Ep2: Victory and Controversy at El Alamein
The Special Operations Executive nurtured and supported Resistance movements across occupied Europe, the Middle East and the Far East while their lives were constantly under threat. Ep2: S.O.E
Exploring medieval London, what Westminster Abbey reveals about the competition between the crown and the city, the cellars below the Ministry of Defence and artefacts owned by Henry VIII. Ep2
The Resistance asked for help in late 1943 as some of their top operatives were being held in Amiens prison and needed rescuing from facing interrogation, torture and execution. Ep2: Prison Busters
From attacks on Pearl Harbor to the British Mediterranean Fleet and the Tirpitz, midget submarines played their part in some of the most gripping stories of the war. Ep2: Midget Submarines
The helicopter gunship's future looked in doubt in the first Gulf War of 1991 - now their biggest threat in the 21st century isn't any sort of enemy, but rather cost. E2: Hellfire and Brimstone
We look at three different German U-boat wrecks from WWII including UC-66 - the first to be sunk by a plane - and U-480, the world's first stealth sub. Ep1: Assassins of the Deep
With David Essex and Ellen Foley. The legendary BAFTA-winning comedy extravaganza from Thames TV (1980). All in the best possible taste!
Hit 70s sitcom starring Jimmy Jewel and Hylda Baker as brother and sister Eli and Nellie Pledge, forced to run a family pickle factory together in Lancashire. S6, E5: The Right Spirit
November 1907: the loss of Emily has affected the staff a great deal, but Mrs Bridges appears to be so upset that she can no longer contain her emotions. S1 E9: Why Is Her Door Locked?
Faced with a huge tax bill, Arthur fakes his own death and hides - but Chisholm is suspicious. S6 E4: Arthur is Dead, Long Live Arthur
When a top international banker is held to ransom, Makepeace offers herself as a hostage. S2 E4: No Surrender
Drama series following the exploits of Life on Mars's DCI Gene Hunt. Alex smells a conspiracy when the body of a worker at a nuclear research centre disappears from the morgue. S1 E4
When Gran is at death's door, Alf is sure she wants him to take her valuable watch - to remember her by, of course. : Gran's Watch
With Freddie Mercury, Gary Numan, The Shadows and The Pretenders. The legendary BAFTA-winning comedy extravaganza from Thames TV (1980) - and all in the best possible taste!
The elusive High Fence is still at large; an arrested suspect has been poisoned to avoid him talking. Simon aims to find out what has happened and who the High Fence is. S2 E23: The High Fence

Examining the history of war tactics. Strategic bombing takes war to the heartland of the enemy. It seeks to destroy not only an enemy's ability to wage war, but also its will to fight on. S2 E3
Discover the real stories of secret operations and spies behind enemy lines in the Gulf War, including a German undercover agent who worked for Iraq. S2 E3: The Gulf War - Secrets in the Sand
The definitive combat helicopter saw first blood in South East Asia and has been transport, gunship, smoke ship, command centre, MediVac and dozens of other roles. S2 E5
A look at how the West End became a place for the wealthy elite, the impact of the railways, a cholera epidemic and engineer Joseph Bazalgette saving London with his new sewerage system. Ep3
The soldiers whose name has become a synonym for heroism and tackling the seemingly impossible; what was the task of the SAS, Britain's elite military force, in World War II? Ep3: SAS
The evolution of the Vietnam conflict from a regional military engagement to an ever-expanding war, here exploring how it was logistically possible and a look at the Huey helicopter and its role.
As Britain began to strike Nazi Germany, it was soon suffering losses from hi-tech air defences; in 1941, British paratroops were sent to seize a German radar system which needed to be cracked.
When it was impossible for aircraft to land safely on enemy territory, gliders were the perfect answer for delivering special forces behind enemy lines. Ep3: Gliders

The US Air Force finds itself flying planes older than the pilots - where do the strategic bomber, and its little brother the fighter bomber, fit into 21st-century warfare? E3: The High Ground vs. SAM
Armed with the latest undersea technology and personal testimony, we board two doomed ships to discover what set them on the path to catastrophe. Ep2: Danger Ahead
With Boomtown Rats. The legendary BAFTA-winning comedy extravaganza from Thames TV (1980). All in the best possible taste!
Hit 70s sitcom starring Jimmy Jewel and Hylda Baker as brother and sister Eli and Nellie Pledge, forced to run a family pickle factory together in Lancashire. S6, E6: A Question Of Taste
It's the autumn of 1908 as Sarah returns while James and Elizabeth are helping the poor at a refuge; soon brought back to the house, Sarah stirs up trouble for all. S1 E10: A Voice From The Past
Arthur sells some goods to a Russian sailor when a ship arrives in port, but he swiftly finds himself involved in a diplomatic situation - and much worse off. S6 E5: From Fulham With Love
Extortion and blackmail lead to a man being murdered, an old friend of Makepeace's being badly injured, and Makepeace taking Dempsey home. S2 E5: Tequila Sunrise
Drama series. Simon Neary is a gangster that Gene has wanted to nail for years, but is stifling his gun deal a way to keep Alex from getting shot in 2008? S1 E5
